description: It seems that the WHO is searching for a cheap, safe, and effective method to address the spread of Ebola in Africa. So far, this disease has infected and killed thousands of people in African countries, making this easily the worst outbreak of Ebola ever. This convalescent serum, injecting the blood of survivors into those that are currently infected, is their latest attempt to stop the spread. The antibodies built up to fight the infection in the survivors would in turn do the same for the currently infected, fighting and preventing the disease within their body. Although it does have many downsides, including infecting the subject with HIV or hepatitis C from the blood transfusions. Without human trials and one hundred percent certainty on all the effects of the convalescent serum, this is honestly just too risky to take a chance on this without much further research and nonhuman testing.
summary: A response to the proposed idea by WHO.
title: Preventing Ebola Through Transfusions
